speaker: MAN
line: Hmm, yes. Love you. Hello.

speaker: GARDENER
line: Good morning, sir.

speaker: MAN
line: Good morning. Good morning, Cecil.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Top of the morning to you Eh, thank you. Goodbye, darling.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Goodbye, Charles. When can I expect you?

speaker: MAN
line: Before supper.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I forgot what it was like to spend a day in court.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's one of the luxuries of hunting down aliens and genetic mutants. You rarely get to press charges.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's open.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's unlocked.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's weird. I'm sure I locked it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Must be an X-File. What's that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I told you I locked the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think it is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ten-to-one, you can't dance to it.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Greetings, Agent Mulder. Six months ago, British Minister of Parliament Reggie Ellicott received an audio cassette much like the one you are listening to now. Unfortunately for Mr. Ellicott, when he popped the tape into the car stereo, he armed a device, which, when he tried to exit the car, created an explosion that was heard five miles away. The Scotland Yard Forensic Team could only identify the poor bastard by his dental records. If only he hadn't reached for the door handle and triggered the detonator. But then how was he to know he was sitting on enough plastique explosive to lift the car forty feet in the air and deposit the engine block on top of a three-story building?

speaker: GREEN
line: Aren't we looking rather ghostly?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's an old friend.

speaker: GREEN
line: Aren't you going to thank me?

speaker: MULDER
line: For what?

speaker: GREEN
line: Saving your life. One tends not to make the same mistake twice.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll try to remember that.

speaker: GREEN
line: Oh, come on, don't tell me you left your sense of humor in Oxford ten years ago?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually. It's one of the few things you didn't drive a stake through.

speaker: GREEN
line: You know, some mistakes are quite worth making twice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana Scully, this is Phoebe Green, terror of Scotland Yard.

speaker: GREEN
line: Hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: What brings you to the colonies?

speaker: GREEN
line: Some clever bloke has been giving the aristocracy a good scare. Killed off a ranking member of Parliament or three for good measure. Set Windsor Castle ablaze in 1992.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your car bomber?

speaker: GREEN
line: No. This one likes to burn his victims alive. Can't figure out how he does it either. Not a crumb of evidence left at the crime scene. The last one died in his front garden, his poor young wife watching helplessly as he went up in smoke.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Irish Republican Army?

speaker: GREEN
line: Our suspect likes to send love letters to his victims' wives. Sent one to the wife of Sir Malcolm Marsden a month ago. Three days later, he narrowly escaped a fire in his garage. Burned to the ground. So they're renting a place out on Cape Cod. Bringing the family over to the states for an extended holiday or until we can catch the dirty bugger.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think he's that determined?

speaker: GREEN
line: Judging by his success, he seems to take a certain delight in his work.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what brings you on this detour to Washington, D.C., Inspector?

speaker: GREEN
line: I figured my friend Mulder couldn't resist a three-pipe problem.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll run it by our arson specialist.

speaker: GREEN
line: Splendid. I'll call London, let them know. Oh, goodbye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Three-pipe problem?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's, uh, from Sherlock Holmes. It's a private joke.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How private?

speaker: MULDER
line: Um... we knew each other in school in England. She was brilliant and, uh, I got in over my head and, uh, paid the price.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you just keep unfolding like a flower.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was over ten years ago, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I noticed how you couldn't drop everything fast enough in order to help her out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I was merely extending her a professional courtesy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, is that what you were extending?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I'm going to run this by the arson guys and then she's on her own.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something tells me you're not going to get rid of her that easily.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Beautiful.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Oh, just beautiful. Look at that. Salmon red flames. This is fourteen-hundred, fifteen-hundred degrees. This is a work of art.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Was there any kind incendiary device used?

speaker: GREEN
line: Yes, actually. The victim's body.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Spontaneous combustion?

speaker: GREEN
line: He was murdered. However, we've turned up no evidence that tells us how the body caught fire.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Well, that's peculiar. People don't normally just catch on fire.

speaker: BEATTY
line: I mean, we burn, but we don't conduct all that well. There's usually some kind of extraneous fuel involved like candle wax, gasoline, something flammable and incendiary that adheres to the skin.

speaker: GREEN
line: Like an accelerant.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Like an accelerant, yes.

speaker: GREEN
line: But we found no trace of anything, save for a dusting of magnesium at two of the sites.

speaker: BEATTY
line: That's aliphatic pyrolysis. It's a residue remaining after an exothermic reaction.

speaker: GREEN
line: But there's no evidence of the source, no pour patterns or ignition devices.

speaker: BEATTY
line: There have been some arson fires in Seattle lately and, uh, Pennsylvania that burn so hot that the firemen can't put them out. 7,000 degrees. I mean, hosing that down just makes it worse.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: BEATTY
line: Uh, the, uh, reaction is so intense that it splits the water into hydrogen and oxygen. Just adds fuel to the fire.

speaker: GREEN
line: What were they using?

speaker: BEATTY
line: We don't know for sure. Could be rocket fuel. That stuff burns so hot and clean, there's never any trace left. You see, it's very difficult to prove arson. It's driving the insurance companies nuts.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Well, that's about the only explanation that I can give you.

speaker: MULDER
line: But there have been cases of pyrokinetics, people who can control and conduct fire.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Well, I've seen fire bend around corners, seen it bounce like a rubber ball. Fire's got a certain genius, you know? A certain demon poetry. It's like it's got a mind of it's own. But I've never seen one that can defy the laws of physics, not when you figure it out. You've, uh...

speaker: BEATTY
line: You've got quite a case for yourself here, Mulder. I almost wish I could be in your shoes.

speaker: JIMMIE
line: Hey, Jackson... boy, that's a nice house.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Oh, what a pleasant surprise.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Welcome to America, Sir Malcolm.

speaker: MOVER
line: Where would you like these boxes?

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Right there.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Over there, please, thank you.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: And over there, as well. But the second one I want upstairs.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Gentlemen, the second set of boxes will go directly upstairs.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: All right?

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Thank you very much.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Hello there.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Hello.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: I'm Bob the caretaker. We've been exchanging letters?

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Oh, good heavens, yes of course, Bob. How are you?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Pleased to meet you.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Hi.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Hi. Just trying to spruce the place up for you.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Well, it's delightful. The photos don't do it justice.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Anything I can do for you, anything at all, you just holler.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Thank you, Bob.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Thanks.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Thank you very much. Seems like a rather nice fellow, don't you think?

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Very.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: My God, darling. That painting rather looks like you. What do you think?

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Oh, I don't know.

speaker: JIMMIE
line: I've never been good at this.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Bloody little cur, I'll skin you alive. See? I'm the caretaker now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, Sherlock, is the game afoot?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm afraid so, Watson. But you're off the hook on this one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: I mean I'm not going to put you through this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put me through what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Phoebe's little mindgame.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's something else I haven't told you about myself, Scully. I hate fire. Hate it. Scared to death of it. When I was a kid, my best friend's house burned down. Had to spend the night in the rubble to keep away looters. For years, I had nightmares about being trapped in a burning building.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait, and Phoebe knows about this?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is classic Phoebe Green. Mindgame player extraordinaire. Ten years it's taken me to forget about this woman, and she shows up in my life with a case like this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So she shows up knowing the power she has over you and then she makes you walk through fire, is that it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Phoebe is fire.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Are you sure you don't want me to help you out on this one?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sooner or later, a man's got to face his demons.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Hello. You're the Marsden's driver?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Who's that?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Bob. Caretaker.

speaker: DRIVER
line: Oh.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Bum a smoke?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Yeah, sure.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: I'm going into town. Can I get you anything?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Yeah. Some cough medicine if it's not a problem.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Syrup or, uh... lozenges?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Syrup would be good. Can I give you some money? I appreciate that.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Beer?

speaker: WOMAN
line: They don't let you bring your own around here.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Well, I guess they'll just have to make an exception, won't they?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Oh, you're English. God, I just love that accent.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Allow me.

speaker: WOMAN
line: And a gentleman to boot. Oh my God. Now that is a trick. Hey guys, take a look at this!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Care for a light?

speaker: MULDER
line: I pulled this report off the wire last night. Eyewitnesses are saying that a customer in the bar caught fire but they're still looking for a body.

speaker: GREEN
line: Any indication an accelerant was used?

speaker: MULDER
line: The bar's across the street from the fire station. It burned to the ground before they had a chance to even respond. The fire marshall said it burned so hot, it turned the concrete foundation into sponge cake. This was a woman who was in the bar. Hello?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: Miss Kotchek?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Special Agent Mulder from the F.B.I. This is Inspector Green.

speaker: GREEN
line: Can you tell us what happened in the bar last night?

speaker: WOMAN
line: There was this guy. I'd had a few drinks, so... he sat next to me and he did this thing. It was like a magic trick where he lit his finger on fire. Next thing, I turned around and he was up in flames.

speaker: GREEN
line: Can you describe him?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Good looking, I think. Brownish hair.

speaker: MULDER
line: Long hair, short hair?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I've already given the police the information.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think you could work with a composite artist and come up with a sketch for us?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I said I had a few drinks...

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I get your full name and address?

speaker: WOMAN
line: See... I live with someone. He thinks I was at school last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's no problem. You can come down to the field office and work with somebody there. I'll give you a minute to think about it, okay?

speaker: GREEN
line: Deftly done, Agent Mulder. Casually disregard her indiscretion. A firm but polite manner until she accedes to cooperate.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a technique I refined in my relationship with you.

speaker: GREEN
line: Oh. Yes, well, I see you haven't lost your sense of humor after all.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, that was a cheap shot. I don't want to dredge up the past. Let's just stick to the case.

speaker: GREEN
line: Let's.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Phoebe, I...

speaker: GREEN
line: Unless I'm mistaken, ten years seems like sufficient time to have forgiven, if not forgotten, a few youthful indiscretions.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm cursed with a photographic memory.

speaker: GREEN
line: And don't you tell me that you've forgotten a certain youthful indiscretion. Atop Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's tombstone on a misty night in Windlesham.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like I said, just stick to the case.

speaker: GREEN
line: Well, it occurred to me that we're going to a lot of trouble to find a description of a man who, in all likelihood, as been burnt to a crisp.

speaker: MULDER
line: I would agree with you but they haven't found a body yet. So can we count on you?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Yeah, okay. I don't know if it matters but I remembered something else about the guy who caught fire. He had an English accent.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Having a rough time, eh?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Yeah...

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Maybe it's the cough syrup.

speaker: SCULLY
line: After reviewing the files of the Scotland Yard arson murders, two points remain unexplained. One is the use of an untraceable accelerant. The other involves the victims. Since they all burned in the presence of family members in safe surroundings, this indicates unusually intimate access to the victims by the arsonist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The arsonist is most likely a male, less than twenty-five years of age. He will often act out of impulse, satisfying sexual urges or insecurities with destructive behavior, which compensates for his social inadequacies or maladjustment.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: You boys want to see a magic trick?

speaker: JIMMIE
line: Okay!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: What's your names?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Michael and Jimmie.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Doesn't he talk?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Yes! What kind of a magic trick?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Maybe I'd better not.

speaker: JIMMIE
line: Show us!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Nah, you might tell your mom and dad.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: We won't tell.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Really? Promise?

speaker: JIMMIE
line: We promise.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Hope to die? Stick a needle in your eye? Okay, boys. You've taken a solemn oath of trust that can't be broken. Except under penalty... of death. Watch...

speaker: JIMMIE
line: No!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Ah, you're too smart for me.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Where did it go?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Where did it go... where do you think it went, Jimmie?

speaker: JIMMIE
line: I don't know.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Ah... I think I remember. Ah... ah... ah... ha! Ta-da!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Do it again!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: You want me to do it again?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Yes!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Okay, we'll do it again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Beatty?

speaker: BEATTY
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Special Agent Dana Scully. Can I... steal a minute of your time?

speaker: BEATTY
line: Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah, sure. Come in, sit down, come here. I'm just working on this Mafia torch job here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm... working with Agent Mulder.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Oh, yeah, wild case. So, what can I do for you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mentioned that the arsonist might be using some kind of rocket fuel as an accelerant.

speaker: BEATTY
line: Yeah, well, that's just speculation. It still doesn't explain how he sets bodies on fire.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if he got some of this fuel into some... hand cream or, uh...

speaker: BEATTY
line: Well, you've got to understand. Even the smallest amounts of this stuff can produce temperatures over 5,000 degrees. But I suppose it's not impossible. Extremely diluted. But you'd still have to find a way to ignite it.

speaker: JIMMIE
line: Wow! Isn't that a great trick?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Now sit down. So... you guys ever smoked a cigarette?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: No, they're bad for you.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Would you like to take a puff, Michael?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: No.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Make a man out of you.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: I don't want to.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Why don't you hold one for me? How about you, Jimmie? Huh, little man?

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Jimmie! Michael! Hello. Hi, Bob. There you are. We've had a bit of bad news. Our driver has taken ill and we're due at a party in Boston this evening. Is there any chance that we can impose upon you to drive the family into town? We'd be more than happy to pay you for your time and certainly to put you out for the night.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: I'd be very happy to do it as a favor.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Well, good. Thank you. All right then, boys, let's go, Daddy's got lunch all ready.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The arsonist is usually unmarried and prone to excessive fantasies about women or men who are inaccessible to him. Often, the setting of fires results from his cowardice and inability to develop a natural relationship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His crimes are often very clever and elaborately planned. The suspicious nature of the fire last night strongly suggests the arsonist has followed Lord Marsden to the United States. A check of all recent immigrations in the northeastern area is underway. It has become not a matter of if, but when he will strike.

speaker: MAN
line: Here's that immigration data you wanted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: MAN
line: You're welcome.

speaker: MULDER
line: Remember those reports I told you about, about people who could control and conduct fire, pyrokinetic?

speaker: GREEN
line: Faintly...

speaker: MULDER
line: I think this guy just sent us a message that he's far more exotic.

speaker: GREEN
line: I'd say so, I mean, he can set himself afire. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just not used to someone so quick to agree with me.

speaker: GREEN
line: Oh.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of protection does the family have?

speaker: GREEN
line: The driver's a very capable bodyguard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he should look into getting a few additional men and limit public exposure.

speaker: GREEN
line: Oh, they've got a party being held in their honor tonight in Boston. They're going to have to cancel.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless you wanted to set a trap.

speaker: GREEN
line: I had thought of that. But we must be careful and discreet. The so why don't you go on ahead and have a look around? Oh, and I've taken a room at the hotel for the night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks. All right, thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's Scully, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm in Boston.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's something I need to show you. I'm going to come up there.

speaker: MULDER
line: What have you got?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I might have some information......on the identity of your arson suspect. You there, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, yeah...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can I meet you somewhere?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it's just that I'm, I'm kind of anticipating having my hands full.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Jimmie, we're here!

speaker: BELLHOP
line: Good evening.

speaker: GREEN
line: Thank you.

speaker: BELLHOP
line: Excuse me, sir.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Hello.

speaker: GREEN
line: Enjoying yourself?

speaker: MULDER
line: Good food, witty conversation. I'm having the time of my life.

speaker: GREEN
line: I wondered if you'd think it's safe enough to indulge ourselves in a dance.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't look like your arsonist is going to make an appearance.

speaker: GREEN
line: That doesn't mean there won't be any fires to put out. I've thought about you often.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a fire upstairs.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: On the fourteenth floor.

speaker: GREEN
line: That's where the children are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've got a fire on the fourteenth floor!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Help, help!

speaker: FIREMAN #1
line: Here we go, got one out. Come on, buddy, come on. Come on, here we go... And we go up!

speaker: FIREMAN #2
line: You got him?

speaker: FIREMAN #1
line: Yup, here we go...

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Here we are.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: You saved their lives.

speaker: GREEN
line: Marvelous. Good job. Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were really out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Phoebe?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's down the hall.

speaker: MULDER
line: How about the kids?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, the doctor checked them out. What happened to you up there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I panicked. I couldn't move, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It could've happened to anyone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but it happened to me. I hared out. Plain and simple.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you know about this guy that saved the kids? The driver?

speaker: GREEN
line: I checked him out prior to the Marsdens' arrival. He's worked on the property for eight years. No record. His references checked out. They were lucky he was here tonight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who was watching the kids tonight?

speaker: GREEN
line: He was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure? I could have sworn I saw him down in the hallway about the same time that the fire broke out.

speaker: GREEN
line: He couldn't have. Anyway, the man we're looking for is English.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: GREEN
line: I came to see if you were okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: How are the kids?

speaker: GREEN
line: They're fine. Everybody's anxious to get back.

speaker: MULDER
line: To the cape?

speaker: GREEN
line: Only to pack. They've, uh, made travel arrangements to return to England the day after tomorrow.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you?

speaker: GREEN
line: I'll be leaving in a few days. Look, I'll give you a ring back at the Bureau before I leave.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right.

speaker: GREEN
line: Goodbye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You at all interested in what I came up here to show you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I did a little checking of my own. I didn't know a whole lot about arson or arsonists so I took the opportunity... for my own edification, of course. I ran a profile of possible incendiary fuels and accelerants that could have been used in the crimes. I also took the liberty of running a search through Interpol of all the gardeners, manservants and domestic help that were hired by the murder victims at the time of their death.

speaker: MULDER
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And these people probably don't even tie their own shoes. There were over two-hundred names. And not a duplicate. Except one. A "Cecil L'Ively." He worked as a gardener for two of the victims.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you find on him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: So he's clean.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently, he was question by Scotland Yard and they released him but I dug a little further. Cecil L'Ively is a documented citizen of Great Britain, paid his taxes, never been on the dole, a model citizen until he died in 1971 in a London tenement fire. I know, that's what I thought. So, I checked a little further. Cecil L'Ively, spelled "L apostrophe," came up again. In fact, it came up twice. First, on a list of death certificates listed among a group of children who died in ritual sacrifice by a satanic cult in 1963 in the Toddingham Woods outside Bath, England.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where else did you find him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're going to love this. On a list of recent visas issued by the British government. Cecil L'Ively's passport was stamped by U.S. immigration officials two weeks ago at the port of entry in Boston.

speaker: MULDER
line: Call the local field office in Boston of the F.B.I. and get them to fax to you the composite that the witness did of the man who burned down the bar and then get them to fax it to every local law enforcement agency in the area.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to try and catch Phoebe, this guy could be waiting for them in Cape Cod.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, this is Special Agent Scully. I've been waiting on hold for you guys to fax me a composite of an arson suspect. Right. Hang on a second. It's coming through. Thanks. Oh my God. It's the driver.

speaker: CELLULAR PHONE MESSAGE
line: We're sorry. The cellular customer you are trying to reach is out of the area.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: His name is Cecil L'Ively.

speaker: GREEN
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your arsonist. Where's the rest of the family?

speaker: GREEN
line: They went outside for a walk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, go find them. We've got to get them packed and get them out of here.

speaker: GREEN
line: Come on, we have to hurry... let's go. Come on, this way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the driver.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. He disappeared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's the matter?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing, um... I found this out in the garage. It's been very hard on the family.

speaker: GREEN
line: Did you get the composite?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: I don't believe it, I can't believe it. He's worked for us for over ten years.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Well, obviously there's been some type of mistake. Oh...

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Oh my God!

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: This isn't the driver, it's the caretaker!

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: And he's upstairs with the children!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Michael?

speaker: MULDER
line: Michael? Jimmie? It looks like we found the missing driver.

speaker: GREEN
line: Mulder! In here, quickly!

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: What's going on?

speaker: GREEN
line: They just went up all by themselves.

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: My God!

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Oh my God...

speaker: MULDER
line: Everybody out!

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Let's go, get out...

speaker: MULDER
line: I think he rigged the whole house.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Oh God...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's fuel.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: What?

speaker: GREEN
line: Oh my God...

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Go, go...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Quick, come on...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, see if you can find a fire extinguisher. Everybody else, outside.

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: But what about the children?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll take care of the children. Go!

speaker: GREEN
line: Are you going to be okay, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh yeah. I'll be fine. There's no place I'd rather be.

speaker: MULDER
line: Michael? Jimmie?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Help...

speaker: L'IVELY
line: Time to call 911.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't move!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Freeze! Federal agent.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: You won't shoot me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stay right where you are.

speaker: L'IVELY
line: See? Cause you don't know the spark from that round won't blow this whole house to kingdom come.

speaker: GREEN
line: Back off the gun! It's the accelerant!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: No!

speaker: LADY MARSDEN
line: Oh Michael! Jimmie!

speaker: MALCOLM MARSDEN
line: Michael! Jimmie! Thank God, thank God!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: You can't kill me!

speaker: L'IVELY
line: You can't fight fire with fire!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Care to take me to lunch? Scare you?

speaker: MULDER
line: You have no idea.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is Phoebe?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't know? She didn't call?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. She did messenger this to me last night though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you play it?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why not? Aren't you curious what's on it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ten-to-one, you can't dance to it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: X-File number 11214893. Addendum to the file opened by Special Agent Mulder. The arson suspect Cecil L'Ively was admitted to Boston Mercy Hospital with fifth and sixth-degree burns over his entire body. Military burn specialists have been brought in to study the case which they're calling "extraordinary." Not only for the fact that the suspect survived, but for the rapid regeneration of his basal cell tissue. Full recovery is anticipated in as little as a month. L'Ively is being held in a high-security medical facility...

speaker: GUARD
line: There you go.

speaker: NURSE
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ...confined to a hyperbaric chamber until he can be tried on murder charges in the death of a Massachusetts caretaker. His body temperature remains at a steady 109 degrees. House technicians have removed everything flammable from his room due to several fires which have broken out in the vicinity. According to Agent Mulder, further incarceration remains a problem for federal penal authorities.

speaker: NURSE
line: Can I get you anything, sir?

speaker: L'IVELY
line: I'm just dying for a cigarette.
